channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: グーグル、YouTubeが購入者を欺いたとの報道を受け、広告動画フォーマットの名称を「インストリーム広告」から「スキップ可能広告」に変更（Catherine Perloff/Adweek）
item.description:
Catherine Perloff / Adweek:
Google changes the name of one of its advertising video formats from “in-stream ads” to “skippable ads”, after a report accused YouTube of misleading buyers  —  What was once in-stream ads are now skippable ads  —  Google changed the name of one of its video formats …

item.title: ESPNがペンにESPN Betでのブランド使用を認める契約は10年間で20億ドルの価値がある：現金15億ドルとペンの株を購入する約5億ドル相当のワラント（Katherine Sayre/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Katherine Sayre / Wall Street Journal:
ESPN's deal allowing Penn to use its brand for ESPN Bet is worth $2B over 10 years: $1.5B in cash plus warrants worth about $500M to purchase shares in Penn  —  Barstool Sportsbook will be rebranded as ESPN Bet; deal includes $1.5 billion in cash over 10 years

item.title: ゴンザレス対グーグル事件とは異なり、テキサス州とフロリダ州のソーシャルメディア・コンテンツ・モデレーション法を争うNetChoice事件を、来年中にSCOTUSが破棄することはできない（Jeff Kosseff/Wired）
item.description:
Jeff Kosseff / Wired:
Unlike in Gonzalez v. Google, SCOTUS in the next year can't just punt the NetChoice cases challenging social media content moderation laws in Texas and Florida  —  Forget Gonzalez v. Google.  There's another dispute that will come before the justices in the next year and this time they will …

item.title: YouTubeは、視聴履歴を完全にオフにすると、ホームページを含む一部の場所でユーザーにおすすめ動画を表示しなくなる（Ben Schoon/9to5Google）
item.description:
Ben Schoon / 9to5Google:
YouTube will stop showing users recommended videos in some places, including the homepage, when watch history is turned off entirely  —  Recommended videos keep users engaged on YouTube, but starting today, YouTube will stop showing recommended videos in some places, such as the homepage, if your watch history is turned off entirely.

item.title: ペン・エンターテインメントがバースツール・スポーツを創業者のデイブ・ポートノイに売却、ポートノイは一定の競業避止義務契約を受諾、ペンはバースツールを5億5100万ドルで買収していた（Axios）
item.description:
Axios:
Penn Entertainment is selling Barstool Sports back to founder Dave Portnoy, who has accepted certain noncompete agreements; Penn had bought Barstool for $551M  —  - Tim Baysinger- Kerry Flynn- Sara Fischer  —  ESPN on Tuesday announced a betting joint venture with casino operator PENN Entertainment …

item.title: BuzzFeed、第2四半期の売上高は前年同期比27％減の7,790万ドル、広告収入は同33％減の3,540万ドル、純損失は前年同期の2,360万ドルに対し2,780万ドルとなり、赤字に転落（Natalie Korach/The Wrap）
item.description:
Natalie Korach / The Wrap:
BuzzFeed misses with Q2 revenue down 27% YoY to $77.9M, ad revenue down 33% YoY to $35.4M, and a net loss of $27.8M vs. $23.6M in Q2 2022  —  The struggling media company reports a net loss Tuesday for the second quarter of $27.8 million  —  BuzzFeed ended June with $41.3 million in cash …

item.title: ESPNとペン・エンターテインメントがESPN Betを立ち上げる契約を発表、ペンはライセンスを取得している米国16州でスポーツブックのブランドを変更。
item.description:
ESPN Press Room U.S.:
ESPN and Penn Entertainment unveil a deal to launch ESPN Bet, as Penn rebrands its sportsbook in the 16 US states where it is licensed; PENN up ~15% after hours  —  Sports betting deal to include a streamlined experience for sports fans  —  ESPN today announced an agreement with PENN Entertainment …

item.title: 2つのニュースルームをピューリッツァー賞に導き、ニーマン・ジャーナリズム・ラボの立ち上げを監督し、ハーバード大学で何百人ものニーマン・フェローを選出・受け入れたボブ・ジャイルズが90歳で死去（Mark Hicks/The Detroit News）。
item.description:
Mark Hicks / The Detroit News:
Bob Giles, who led two newsrooms to Pulitzers, oversaw Nieman Journalism Lab's launch, and selected and hosted hundreds of Nieman Fellows at Harvard, dies at 90  —  Former Detroit News editor and publisher Bob Giles ― who led the paper to a Pulitzer Prize, the highest honor in journalism …

item.title: The Atlanticのニコラス・トンプソンCEOは、2024年には黒字にしたい、より利益率の高い広告契約を模索する予定、92万5000人の購読者がいる、と語っている（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
The Atlantic CEO Nicholas Thompson says the outlet hopes to be profitable in 2024, plans to seek higher-margin ad deals, and has 925K subscribers  —  The Atlantic has booked $19.5 million in advertising and events revenue so far this year, according to data shown to staff during …

item.title: 情報筋グーグルとUMG、AIが作る楽曲のためにアーティストのメロディと声のライセンスを得る交渉中、目標はファン向けツールの作成と著作権者への支払い（Financial Times）
item.description:
Financial Times:
Sources: Google and UMG are in talks to license artists' melodies and voices for AI-made songs; goals include making a tool for fans and paying copyright owners  —  New technology that can mimic artists' voices has been seen as growing threat  —  Google and Universal Music are in talks …

item.title: ニュース・メディア・カナダ、カナダ放送協会、CBC、ラジオ・カナダが、メタ社のニュース記事ブロッキングを調査するようカナダの競争監視機関に要請（Agence France-Presse）
item.description:
Agence France-Presse:
News Media Canada, the Canadian Association of Broadcasters, CBC, and Radio-Canada ask Canada's competition watchdog to investigate Meta's news article blocking  —  Media on Tuesday asked Canada's competition watchdog to investigate Meta's blocking of news articles on Facebook and Instagram …

item.title: OpenAIは、ニューヨーク大学のジャーナリズムスクールで、ジャーナリズム倫理の問題に関するワークショップを提供する新しい取り組みに39万5000ドルの助成金を提供する予定だ（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
OpenAI plans to offer a $395K grant to fund a new initiative at New York University's journalism school that will provide workshops on journalism ethics issues  —  OpenAI, the parent company to ChatGPT, will fund a new journalism ethics initiative at New York University's Arthur L. Carter Journalism Institute …

item.title: コンシューマー・リポート』誌の購読者数を430万人に倍増させたコンシューマー・ユニオンの元事務局長兼社長ローダ・カルパトキン氏が8月4日、93歳で死去した（サム・ロバーツ／ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
Sam Roberts / New York Times:
Rhoda Karpatkin, the former executive director and president of Consumer Union who doubled Consumer Reports subscriptions to 4.3M, died on August 4 at 93  —  The first woman to be named executive director of Consumers Union, the publisher of Consumer Reports, she expanded its readership and its influence in Washington.

item.title: Dishの報告によると、Dish TVは第2四半期に19.7万契約を失い690万契約、Sling TVは9.7万契約を失い200万契約、有料TV総加入者数は前年同期比11％減の890万契約（Luke Bouma/Cord Cutters News）
item.description:
Luke Bouma / Cord Cutters News:
Dish reports Dish TV lost 197K subscribers in Q2, leaving 6.9M, Sling TV lost 97K subscribers, leaving 2M, and total pay TV subscribers fell 11% YoY to 8.9M  —  Today DISH announced its 2nd quarter 2023 earnings and reported that DISH and Sling TV lost 294,000 subscribers.

item.title: 韓国放送俳優組合によれば、ネットフリックスはSAG-AFTRAのもとで米国の俳優が得ているのと同じ残留賃金を要求しており、面会の呼びかけに応じないとのこと（Max Kim/Los Angeles Times）。
item.description:
Max Kim / Los Angeles Times:
The Korea Broadcasting Actors Union says Netflix is not responding to calls to meet, as the union asks for the same residuals that US actors get under SAG-AFTRA  —  As news of the SAG-AFTRA strike broke in mid-July, Song Chang-gon, a 51-year-old actor and current president …
